clinical_study.official_title: Predictors of Post-operative Pain in Shoulder Surgery, a Prospective Observational Study

lead_sponsor.agency: American University of Beirut Medical Center

clinical_study.source: American University of Beirut Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective observational study conducted at the American University of Beirut Medical center that targets patients undergoing shoulder surgeries. It is conducted to to prospectively collect patient, surgery and anesthesia-related variables and perform correlation studies with postoperative pain severity, patients' satisfaction and analgesic consumption following shoulder surgery.
In addition, identifying predictors for postoperative pain will contribute to adjust pain management protocols as per surgical and patients' factors.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative change in pain intensity (NRS pain scale)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours, 3 days and one week after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Asses the change in pain intensity after the surgery using the NRS pain score (0-10)

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative change in satisfaction with pain management (NRS satisfaction scale)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours, 3 days and one week after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Asses the change in satisfaction with the pain management protocol using the NRS satisfaction score (0-10)
Analgesic consumption over one week after the surgery
The QuickDASH questionnaire includes questions about the symptoms and ability to do certain activities

intervention.intervention_name: Shoulder surgery and post-op pharmacological treatment
intervention.description: Usual care surgery (shoulder arthroscopy) and post-operative pain management protocol

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients older than 18 years of age and admitted to the American University of Beirut Medical Center for any shoulder surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients > 18 years old admitted to the American University of Beirut - Medical Center for any shoulder surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients suffering of opioids addiction (or previous history of addiction) or drug abuse.
